crates/fast-ta-experiments/src/data.rs.description: Synthetic data generators using ChaCha8Rng from rand_chacha for deterministic benchmarks. Key functions: generate_random_walk(n, seed), generate_ohlcv(n, seed), inject_nans(series, ratio, seed). OHLCV struct has validate_invariants() method for testing.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/traits.rs.description: SeriesElement trait extends num_traits::Float with additional methods for safe numeric conversions (from_usize, from_i32, from_f64). Blanket implementation covers all Float + NumCast + Copy + Default + Send + Sync types. ValidatedInput trait provides validation methods for slices and vectors.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/error.rs.description: Error enum with variants: InsufficientData(required, actual), NumericConversion(context), CyclicDependency(node_id), EmptyInput, InvalidPeriod(period, reason). Implements Display and std::error::Error. Result<T> type alias for Result<T, Error>.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/sma.r.description: SMA indicator implementation using O(n) rolling sum approach. Two functions provided: sma() which allocates a new output vector, and sma_into() which writes to a pre-allocated buffer. First (period-1) values are NaN. Comprehensive test suite with 30+ tests covering basic functionality, edge cases, error handling, and property-based tests.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/ema.r.description: EMA indicator implementation with two smoothing variants: standard EMA (alpha = 2/(period+1)) and Wilder's smoothing (alpha = 1/period). Functions provided: ema(), ema_into(), ema_wilder(), ema_wilder_into(), ema_with_alpha(), ema_with_alpha_into(). Also includes period conversion utilities: wilder_to_standard_period() and standard_to_wilder_period(). SMA is used as the seed value for the first EMA calculation.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/rsi.r.description: RSI indicator implementation using Wilder smoothing. Functions: rsi() and rsi_into(). First `period` values are NaN (need period+1 data points for first value). Boundary conditions: all gains → 100, all losses → 0, no movement → 50. Uses Wilder's smoothing formula: new_avg = (prev_avg * (period-1) + current) / period.

crates/fast-ta-core/src/indicators/macd..description: MACD indicator implementation using EMA components. Provides three outputs: MACD line (fast EMA - slow EMA), signal line (EMA of MACD line), and histogram (MACD - signal). MacdOutput struct bundles all three vectors. Functions: macd() and macd_into(). Standard parameters are 12, 26, 9. First slow_period-1 MACD values are NaN, first slow_period+signal_period-2 signal/histogram values are NaN.
